channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Deep Fusion Transformer Network with Weighted Vector-Wise Keypoints Voting for Robust 6D Object Pose Estimation
item.description: One critical challenge in 6D object pose estimation from a single RGBD image is efficient integration of two different modalities, i. e., color and depth.

item.title: PlankAssembly: Robust 3D Reconstruction from Three Orthographic Views with Learnt Shape Programs
item.description: In this paper, we develop a new method to automatically convert 2D line drawings from three orthographic views into 3D CAD models.

item.title: FINER: Enhancing State-of-the-art Classifiers with Feature Attribution to Facilitate Security Analysis
item.description: Although feature attribution (FA) methods can be used to explain deep learning, the underlying classifier is still blind to what behavior is suspicious, and the generated explanation cannot adapt to downstream tasks, incurring poor explanation fidelity and intelligibility.

item.title: SSLRec: A Self-Supervised Learning Library for Recommendation
item.description: Our SSLRec platform covers a comprehensive set of state-of-the-art SSL-enhanced recommendation models across different scenarios, enabling researchers to evaluate these cutting-edge models and drive further innovation in the field.

item.title: Counterfactual Cross-modality Reasoning for Weakly Supervised Video Moment Localization
item.description: Finally, by suppressing the unimodal effect of masked query, we can rectify the reconstructions of video proposals to perform reasonable contrastive learning.

item.title: A Comparative Visual Analytics Framework for Evaluating Evolutionary Processes in Multi-objective Optimization
item.description: Evolutionary multi-objective optimization (EMO) algorithms have been demonstrated to be effective in solving multi-criteria decision-making problems.

item.title: Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation by Direction-aware Cumulative Convolution Network
item.description: To bridge this gap, we propose a new Direction-aware Cumulative Convolution Network (DaCCN), which improves the depth feature representation in two aspects.

item.title: Shadow Datasets, New challenging datasets for Causal Representation Learning
item.description: Most causal representation learning (CRL) methods are fully supervised, which is impractical due to costly labeling.

item.title: MapTRv2: An End-to-End Framework for Online Vectorized HD Map Construction
item.description: We propose a unified permutation-equivalent modeling approach, \ie, modeling map element as a point set with a group of equivalent permutations, which accurately describes the shape of map element and stabilizes the learning process.

item.title: Robust Asymmetric Loss for Multi-Label Long-Tailed Learning
item.description: Although a model can be highly fine-tuned due to a large number of hyper-parameters, it is difficult to optimize all hyper-parameters at the same time, and there might be a risk of overfitting a model.

item.title: RLSAC: Reinforcement Learning enhanced Sample Consensus for End-to-End Robust Estimation
item.description: Therefore, RLSAC can avoid differentiating to learn the features and the feedback of downstream tasks for end-to-end robust estimation.

item.title: Enhancing Low-light Light Field Images with A Deep Compensation Unfolding Network
item.description: This paper presents a novel and interpretable end-to-end learning framework, called the deep compensation unfolding network (DCUNet), for restoring light field (LF) images captured under low-light conditions.

item.title: Surface Masked AutoEncoder: Self-Supervision for Cortical Imaging Data
item.description: By reconstructing surface data from a masked version of the input, the proposed method effectively models cortical structure to learn strong representations that translate to improved performance in downstream tasks.

item.title: Speech-Driven 3D Face Animation with Composite and Regional Facial Movements
item.description: This paper emphasizes the importance of considering both the composite and regional natures of facial movements in speech-driven 3D face animation.

item.title: Progressive Spatio-temporal Perception for Audio-Visual Question Answering
item.description: Such naturally multi-modal videos are composed of rich and complex dynamic audio-visual components, where most of which could be unrelated to the given questions, or even play as interference in answering the content of interest.

item.title: Is there progress in activity progress prediction?
item.description: We conclude that the progress prediction task is ill-posed on the currently used real-world datasets.

item.title: Deformable Mixer Transformer with Gating for Multi-Task Learning of Dense Prediction
item.description: In this work, we present a novel MTL model by combining both merits of deformable CNN and query-based Transformer with shared gating for multi-task learning of dense prediction.

item.title: Double-chain Constraints for 3D Human Pose Estimation in Images and Videos
item.description: Notably, our model achieves state-of-the-art performance on all action categories in the Human3. 6M dataset using detected 2D poses from CPN, and our code is available at: https://github. com/KHB1698/DC-GCT.

item.title: Multi-domain Recommendation with Embedding Disentangling and Domain Alignment
item.description: We propose a new MDR method named EDDA with two key components, i. e., embedding disentangling recommender and domain alignment, to tackle the two challenges respectively.

item.title: Interaction-aware Joint Attention Estimation Using People Attributes
item.description: We introduce a specialized MLP head with positional embedding to the Transformer so that it predicts pixelwise confidence of joint attention for generating the confidence heatmap.

item.title: Exploring XAI for the Arts: Explaining Latent Space in Generative Music
item.description: We increase the explainability of the model by: i) using latent space regularisation to force some specific dimensions of the latent space to map to meaningful musical attributes, ii) providing a user interface feedback loop to allow people to adjust dimensions of the latent space and observe the results of these changes in real-time, iii) providing a visualisation of the musical attributes in the latent space to help people understand and predict the effect of changes to latent space dimensions.

item.title: Adaptive Taxonomy Learning and Historical Patterns Modelling for Patent Classification
item.description: Finally, we combine the contextual information of patent texts that contains the semantics of IPC codes, and assignees' sequential preferences to make predictions.

item.title: Beyond Semantics: Learning a Behavior Augmented Relevance Model with Self-supervised Learning
item.description: Drawing inspiration from this, we devise a novel Behavior Augmented Relevance Learning model for Alipay Search (BARL-ASe) that leverages neighbor queries of target item and neighbor items of target query to complement target query-item semantic matching.

item.title: A Comparative Assessment of Multi-view fusion learning for Crop Classification
item.description: Instead, we present a comparison of multi-view fusion methods for three different datasets and show that, depending on the test region, different methods obtain the best performance.

item.title: A Preliminary Study of the Intrinsic Relationship between Complexity and Alignment
item.description: By adjusting the number of added nodes, we can control the difficulty level in the modified instruction data.

item.title: Vector quantization loss analysis in VQGANs: a single-GPU ablation study for image-to-image synthesis
item.description: This study performs an ablation analysis of Vector Quantized Generative Adversarial Networks (VQGANs), concentrating on image-to-image synthesis utilizing a single NVIDIA A100 GPU.

item.title: Improved Multi-Shot Diffusion-Weighted MRI with Zero-Shot Self-Supervised Learning Reconstruction
item.description: In this study, we introduce a novel msEPI reconstruction approach called zero-MIRID (zero-shot self-supervised learning of Multi-shot Image Reconstruction for Improved Diffusion MRI).

item.title: Towards true discovery of the differential equations
item.description: Differential equation discovery, a machine learning subfield, is used to develop interpretable models, particularly in nature-related applications.

item.title: Intrinsic Motivation via Surprise Memory
item.description: We present a new computing model for intrinsic rewards in reinforcement learning that addresses the limitations of existing surprise-driven explorations.

item.title: Conformer-based Target-Speaker Automatic Speech Recognition for Single-Channel Audio
item.description: We propose CONF-TSASR, a non-autoregressive end-to-end time-frequency domain architecture for single-channel target-speaker automatic speech recognition (TS-ASR).

item.title: Kairos: : Practical Intrusion Detection and Investigation using Whole-system Provenance
item.description: Sifting through their design documents, we identify four common dimensions that drive the development of provenance-based intrusion detection systems (PIDSes): scope (can PIDSes detect modern attacks that infiltrate across application boundaries?

item.title: Integrating large language models and active inference to understand eye movements in reading and dyslexia
item.description: We present a novel computational model employing hierarchical active inference to simulate reading and eye movements.

item.title: DiVa: An Iterative Framework to Harvest More Diverse and Valid Labels from User Comments for Music
item.description: Based on the observation that such missing information may already be presented in user comments, we propose to study the automated music labeling in an essential but under-explored setting, where the model is required to harvest more diverse and valid labels from the users' comments given limited gold labels.

item.title: A Bipartite Graph is All We Need for Enhancing Emotional Reasoning with Commonsense Knowledge
item.description: However, most previous knowledge infusion methods perform empirical knowledge filtering and design highly customized architectures for knowledge interaction with the utterances, which can discard useful knowledge aspects and limit their generalizability to different knowledge sources.

item.title: SUnAA: Sparse Unmixing using Archetypal Analysis
item.description: Unlike most conventional sparse unmixing methods, here the minimization problem is non-convex.

item.title: Evaluating the Generation Capabilities of Large Chinese Language Models
item.description: This paper presents CG-Eval, the first comprehensive evaluation of the generation capabilities of large Chinese language models across a wide range of academic disciplines.

item.title: IDiff-Face: Synthetic-based Face Recognition through Fizzy Identity-Conditioned Diffusion Models
item.description: The availability of large-scale authentic face databases has been crucial to the significant advances made in face recognition research over the past decade.

item.title: Dual Intents Graph Modeling for User-centric Group Discovery
item.description: Therefore, user-centric group discovery task, i. e., recommending groups to users can help both users' online experiences and platforms' long-term developments.

item.title: CasCIFF: A Cross-Domain Information Fusion Framework Tailored for Cascade Prediction in Social Networks
item.description: Existing approaches for information cascade prediction fall into three main categories: feature-driven methods, point process-based methods, and deep learning-based methods.

item.title: Directed differential equation discovery using modified mutation and cross-over operators
item.description: The discovery of equations with knowledge of the process origin is a tempting prospect.

item.title: SelectNAdapt: Support Set Selection for Few-Shot Domain Adaptation
item.description: Few-shot domain adaptation mitigates this issue by adapting deep neural networks pre-trained on the source domain to the target domain using a randomly selected and annotated support set from the target domain.

item.title: Resource Constrained Model Compression via Minimax Optimization for Spiking Neural Networks
item.description: We propose an improved end-to-end Minimax optimization method for this sparse learning problem to better balance the model performance and the computation efficiency.

item.title: LLMeBench: A Flexible Framework for Accelerating LLMs Benchmarking
item.description: Initially developed to evaluate Arabic NLP tasks using OpenAI's GPT and BLOOM models; it can be seamlessly customized for any NLP task and model, regardless of language.

item.title: Density Crop-guided Semi-supervised Object Detection in Aerial Images
item.description: One of the important bottlenecks in training modern object detectors is the need for labeled images where bounding box annotations have to be produced for each object present in the image.

item.title: Parallel Knowledge Enhancement based Framework for Multi-behavior Recommendation
item.description: In the fusion step, advanced neural networks are used to model the hierarchical correlations between user behaviors.

item.title: Deep Learning for Morphological Identification of Extended Radio Galaxies using Weak Labels
item.description: The CAMs are further refined using an inter-pixel relations network (IRNet) to get instance segmentation masks over radio galaxies and the positions of their infrared hosts.

item.title: When and How Does Known Class Help Discover Unknown Ones? Provable Understanding Through Spectral Analysis
item.description: This paper bridges the gap by providing an analytical framework to formalize and investigate when and how known classes can help discover novel classes.

item.title: Decorrelating neurons using persistence
item.description: We propose a novel way to improve the generalisation capacity of deep learning models by reducing high correlations between neurons.

item.title: Volumetric Fast Fourier Convolution for Detecting Ink on the Carbonized Herculaneum Papyri
item.description: Recent advancements in Digital Document Restoration (DDR) have led to significant breakthroughs in analyzing highly damaged written artifacts.

item.title: AspectMMKG: A Multi-modal Knowledge Graph with Aspect-aware Entities
item.description: Multi-modal knowledge graphs (MMKGs) combine different modal data (e. g., text and image) for a comprehensive understanding of entities.
